file_content.text: Perhaps you're our best hope in this war, after all.
My lord. I was told to expect you.
Ah, you've returned. I... I was told to expect you.
For destroying the outcast Raklann, and for securing Voss, you have the Empire's thanks. Darth Serevin asks that you accept this small reward.
It sounds like you've learned how to address your superiors.
Your manners have improved.
Forgive me, my lord, but I didn't believe anyone could--it doesn't matter. I've seen how wrong I was.
Did Darth Serevin give you a few lessons in protocol?
Your manners have improved.
N--no. But I--I misjudged you. I thought the tales of your achievements were just that: tales. I was wrong.
Thank you. I should go.
I guess I'll take it.
Before you go--Raklann's death is a great success. I've been ordered to ensure word of it reaches the Imperial military.
Nothing will stand in the way of our victory. Not even the Republic. You've more than proven that today.
Lord Pallas can tell you more of Raklann than I.
Impressive. I feel almost underdressed in such well-armed company.
Goodness. You're looking extremely well, my lord, considering the rumors back on Dromund Kaas.
My lord. You're looking better--a new spring in your step. That ritual must have been quite invigorating.
I wonder. Is that the blaster that finally put General Thelonia in her place? How exciting.
Fresh from your audience with the Three--even a whiff of incense still clinging to you. Yes, I know of you, agent.
How impressive. You cut an interesting figure in this dull, pacifist town.
I bring a message from Darth Serevin. He has a remarkably high opinion of you, and your endeavors.
If you were my servant, you'd soon learn to address your betters properly.
You are insolent.
Not so long ago, I'd have been destroyed for speaking like that to a Lord of the Sith.
You forget your manners.
One simply hears so many exaggerations. My lord.
If Serevin hired anyone else, he'd be wasting his credits.
He should. I'm the best.
Indeed. And he requires your doubtless considerable skills.
I hope Darth Serevin is discreet about his opinions.
My "endeavors" are classified.
But of course. Though, he considers your talents obvious to all.
Give me your message.
What does Darth Serevin want?
Nothing says "respect" as clearly as a face-to-face meeting.
He should have come himself.
Of course. But urgent matters occupy his time.
Darth Serevin sends word that we may soon be facing a new front in the war. Here, on Voss.
Our enemy is a Gormak warlord, Raklann. He has gathered several minor tribes and chieftains into a powerful army, and has begun waging war against us.
How is this "Raklann" a serious threat to the Empire?
A Gormak is that dangerous?
Nobody starts a war without a reason.
Sounds like he has a grudge.
Our forces destroyed Raklann's tribe, and he was cast out from Gormak society. Not cast far enough, it seems.
Get to the end.
Raklann's bold. He's focusing on the Voss who have befriended us--he even destroyed a caravan of pilgrims who were under our protection.
We must protect our Voss allies, but Darth Serevin fears becoming embroiled in a long guerrilla war here, when we have more... pressing concerns.
The Republic's close to defeat. Fighting on Voss would waste our resources at just the wrong time.
Like destroying the Republic.
If you're fighting Gormak, you're not wiping out the Republic.
Your fight with the Republic.
So you see, this cannot be allowed to continue.
Then we stop Raklann first.
I'm sure your master can finish off a pack of Gormak without my help.
Darth Serevin can handle this.
Perhaps I've understated, my lord. Without you, defeating Raklann will cost us time and men we cannot afford, if the Republic is to fall.
And if we waste troops fighting Raklann, what will that mean for the war? We cannot afford to be divided with the Republic so close to defeat.
We can't risk losing the war.
Fine. If I must.
Raklann and his tribes have gathered in the Pelath-Ri Marches; if you wish to fight, I have a speeder fueled and ready.
When you arrive, speak to Lord Pallas at Tarah Outpost. I'm sure he'll put your talents to best use.
No means no. [Refuse quest]
So Darth Serevin's confidence was misplaced. Such a shame.
I suppose these Voss are attractive enough, but their choice of clothes....
